page.title: 17The Brightside Fire, Sheff.
page.content: The largest fire in Sheffield since the war started in a huge warehouse in Brightside Lane on December 14th 1984. About 400 Firemen were involved and 17 major appliances. The fire smouldered for 6 days. Damage to the warehouse and its contents was estimated at 20 million pounds. Asbestos debris necessitated the temporary closure of 50 local schools. { Brightside is burning { With nasty black smoke { Simon Snorkels up up in the air { Turntables swaying in the breeze. { Flames whooshing up { And walls crashing down { Sheets of burning bitumen { Flying through the air { Ripping, stripping { Melting, tumbling { Leaving flecks of blue and white { In the blackening sky.
